Package BusinessLogic

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • BusinessLogic.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a database manager just like CommuteDAtabaseManager. This databasemanager only handles user information. Uses the Crypter class for sotring passwords. In database, key value of each user is email so no duplicates

    • Method Detail

      • createTable

        private void createTable​()
        This method is invoked whenever constructor is called. Checks if table exists in db, if not create it. Otherwise continue...

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate​(java.lang.String email,
                            java.lang.String plainPass)
        Checks if user and passwords match. returns a boolean of success.
        Parameters:
        email - plaintext email from UI field
        plainPass - plaintext password from UI: crypting moved from front to back
        Returns:
        Returns true if passwords matched, else returns false.

      • addNewUser

        public void addNewUser​(java.lang.String Fname,
                       java.lang.String Lname,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       java.lang.String plainPass)
        Simply adds a new user to database. Make sure none of the fields are empty. This is front-end's reponsibility.
        Parameters:
        Fname - Front name
        Lname - Last name
        email - email address to associate account with (login name)
        plainPass - desired passwords as plaintext

      • userExists

        public boolean userExists​(java.lang.String email)
        Checks if user exists. This should be called before authentication for obvious reasons.
        Parameters:
        email - email (login id) of user.
        Returns:
        returns a boolean of success

      • updatePassword

        public boolean updatePassword​(java.lang.String plainPass,
                              java.lang.String email)
        Updates user's password. This should only be done after authentication. And that is also front-end's responsibility.
        Parameters:
        plainPass - password as plaintext
        email - email (user id) to have password changed on
        Returns:
        returns boolean of success

      • addAddress

        public boolean addAddress​(java.lang.String address,
                          java.lang.String email)
        Adds address to user
        Parameters:
        address - address as string. Format is front-end responsibility
        email - account that address should be associated with
        Returns:
        returns boolean of success

      • addPhone

        public boolean addPhone​(java.lang.String phone,
                        java.lang.String email)
        Adds phone number to user
        Parameters:
        phone - number to be attached. Format is front-end's reponsibility
        email - account that phone no. should be associated with
        Returns:
        boolean of success

      • addCard

        public boolean addCard​(java.lang.String card,
                       java.lang.String email)
        Adds a credit card to user
        Parameters:
        card - CC number. Format is again front-end's responsibility
        email - account that CC should be associated with
        Returns:
        boolean of success

      • getUserName

        public java.lang.String getUserName​(java.lang.String email)
        Returns the user's Fname and Lname Assume user exists and has both names in database.
        Parameters:
        email - Users email address
        Returns:
        the name retrieved from database

        public java.lang.String getAddress​(java.lang.String email)

        Returns:
        the address retrieved from database

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the CC retrieved from database

      • isAdmin

        public boolean isAdmin​(java.lang.String email)
        Checks if user is admin. User is admin if the field "admin" in database is 1
        Parameters:
        email - account to run check on
        Returns:
        boolean of success
